official-title.#text: To improve the circulation of $1 coins, to remove barriers to the circulation of such coins, and for other purposes.

text.#text: The ninth proviso of

header.#text: Saving taxpayers funds by transitioning to the use of $1 coins

text.#text: It is the policy of the United States that after $1 coins achieve sufficient market penetration such that consumers and retailers are comfortable using $1 coins and are able to obtain adequate supplies of $1 coins, $1 coins should replace $1 Federal Reserve notes as the only $1 monetary unit issued and circulated by the
Federal Reserve banks may continue to place into circulation $1 Federal Reserve notes until the earlier of—

header.#text: Deadline for placing $1 Federal Reserve notes into circulation

text.#text: the date on which the number of $1 coins placed into circulation after the date of the enactment of this Act exceeds 600,000,000 annually; or
the date that is 4 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a Federal Reserve bank may not order additional $1 Federal Reserve notes but may, for a period of one year, continue to place into circulation $1 Federal Reserve notes on hand or those deposited with it, except for notes described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Currency Optimization, Innovation, and National Savings Act/s:3/ss:b
Currency Optimization, Innovation, and National Savings Act/s:3/ss:d

text.#text: After the date referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a Federal Reserve bank shall continue to remove unfit currency from circulation, and shall continue to destroy such currency.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Currency Optimization, Innovation, and National Savings Act/s:3/ss:b

text.#text: Notwithstanding

Notwithstanding any other subsection of this section, $1 Federal Reserve notes are legal tender in the United States for all debts, public and private, public charges, taxes, and duties, regardless of the date of printing or issue.
